Description: Opportunity Management Group (OMG) is a quickly growing sales & marketing firm committed to creating opportunities for growth & expansion.
Full Description: Opportunity Management Group, open since March 2016, is a Charlotte based direct sales and marketing firm. We transform leaders into business owners by focusing on leadership development, management training, and communications coaching.  We partner with highly respected companies nationwide by offering them professionally trained sales teams to represent their brand, improve name recognition, and expand market reach.  But why wouldn't these firms just do their own sales? By outsourcing to Opportunity Management Group, they save time, money, and increase their profit margins.  Instead of focusing on recruiting, interviewing, hiring, etc their own sales team, Opportunity Management Group hires our own team. That alone saves our clients hours of work where they can reinvest that in creating a better product for us to market. This also saves our clients money they would have put into hiring and training new teams and allows them to spend that elsewhere or lower the cost of their product, also making it easier for us to sell (win win situation again). Lastly, our clients do not pay us unless we produce results. Working with Opportunity Management Group becomes a clear no brainer for our clients. Now how do we make working with our team a no brainer? We promise only internal advancement opportunities that will be given based on merit and by hitting clear targets. Our clients have been pushing us to expand since late 2016, and while this is quite exciting, it is our job to ensure our team is ready to move into leadership and management roles where they will be solely responsible for one of our franchised branches.  Pushing our team to think bigger in their career is exciting. It is one of our greatest joys to see our team expand their comfort zones and try new things. Our firm is all about friendly competition and building each other up to new heights once not even imaginable. We are growing in Charlotte and only want to continue to work with the ultimate best of the best.  Learn more at http://opportunitymanagementgroup.com

Industries: Customer Service, Internet, Internet of Things, Wearables

Description: Developed an end to end IoT ecosystem to help enable our customers and their products into the Smart Age.
Full Description: Kloog was founded in 2014 by twin brothers, Adib and Niaz, who dreamt of working together from an early age. Both were fascinated by computers growing up and loved the idea of building things, so they pursued similar but separate paths in engineering. Adib was excited about designing hardware and Niaz was passionate about developing software. After building products in the mobile and consumer electronics space for well over a decade, they decided to pursue their dream. Kloog is a stealth mode IoT and Wearables startup that built an intelligent micro-services analytics cloud platform and hardware platform (Kloog Technology).  Our platform applied deep learning to understand collected sensor (structured) and conversation (unstructured data) to provide unique actionable insights.  The cloud platform was built on top a technology stack which included: Mesos, Spark, MLib, Flink, TensorFlow, scikit-Learn, CEP, Vert.x, Redis, Kafka, Blockchain, Zeppelin, and others.  The hardware platform was designed for building low-cost, power-efficient IoT and Wearable devices to work optimally with our cloud platform, completing an end-to-end ecosystem.

Industries: Consumer Electronics, Customer Service, Health Care, Service Industry, Software
Industry Groups: Consumer Electronics, Hardware, Health Care, Other, Professional Services, Software
Description: Checked In, LLC mobile application suite measures and publishes real time patient wait times for patients to choose the best wait.
Full Description: Checked In, LLC is a mobile application suite that measures and publishes door to room patient wait times.  The medical field is changing. Medicare and Medicaid reimbursements hinge on HCAPS surveys (patient satisfaction). Patients behave like consumers. Malpractice lawsuits are common. There are more patients than available physicians. Access to healthcare is a hot topic and means more than just whether a patient has insurance or not. It literally means was a patient able to get an appointment before they became so ill they showed up at the ER with sepsis, heart failure, kidney failure, liver failure, etc. Medical conditions that could have been easily managed in the early stages become financial disasters at this point that cost insurers, patients, and CMS an extraordinary amount of money. Had the patient been able to access healthcare in a timely manner, debilitating health deficits and money would be saved. In extreme cases, human lives could have been saved. Checked In, LLC aggregates wait time data by geolocation allowing patients to choose a healthcare facility that is readily available to treat their healthcare needs. In addition to saving lives, publishing patient wait times has many benefits for healthcare providers. It increases providers’ bottom line: Improve visibility, Decrease liability, Decrease insurance costs, Increase patient satisfaction, Increases patient safety, Increase reimbursements, Evenly distribute patient population across healthcare systems so one facility is not overwhelmed, while a nearby facility is underperforming, Records patient data & trends. The intention of our applications is not to place pressure on organizations and staff to shorten how long customers wait for service. Our intention is to influence patients’ expectations to be realistic, allowing your organization and staff to provide high quality customer service in a way that values your customers’ time. Checked In, LLC mobile applications are a time management tool that improves customer satisfaction through patient experience and back end performance metrics. Patients behave like consumers and are looking for customer service that is timely and efficient. This often places pressure on organizations and staff to rush in order to meet patients’ wait time expectations. Rushing is dangerous, because mistakes can happen and these mistakes ultimately decrease the quality of patients’ healthcare and in extreme cases lead to sentinel events.
